trans-unit.source: ENet omits certain higher level networking features such as authentication, lobbying, server discovery, encryption, or other similar tasks that are particularly application specific so that the library remains flexible, portable, and easily embeddable.
trans-unit.target: ENet省略了某些更高层次的网络功能,如认证、游说、服务器发现、加密或其他类似的特别针对应用的任务,从而使该库保持灵活、可移植和易于嵌入。

trans-unit.source: ENet performs some filtering on the round trip times and it takes some time until the parameters are accurate. To speed it up you can set the value of the last round trip time to a more accurate guess.
trans-unit.target: ENet会对往返时间进行一些过滤,需要一些时间,直到参数准确为止。为了加快速度,你可以将最后一次往返时间的值设置为更准确的猜测。

trans-unit.source: ENet performs some filtering on the round trip times and it takes some time until the parameters are accurate. To speed it up, set the last round trip time to an accurate guess.
trans-unit.target: ENet对往返时间执行一些过滤，直到参数准确为止需要花费一些时间。为了加快速度，请将上次往返时间设置为准确的猜测。

trans-unit.source: ENet's purpose is to provide a relatively thin, simple and robust network communication layer for games on top of UDP (User Datagram Protocol).The primary feature it provides is optional reliable, in-order delivery of packets.
trans-unit.target: ENet的目的是在UDP(User Datagram Protocol,用户数据报协议)的基础上,为游戏提供一个相对轻薄、简单、健壮的网络通信层,它提供的主要功能是可选的可靠的、按顺序传送数据包。

trans-unit.source: Each instance can have unique properties (positions, colors, etc.) but will not by default unless a custom Shader along with either per-instance vertex attributes or the love_InstanceID GLSL 3 vertex shader variable is used, otherwise they will all render at the same position on top of each other.

Each sprite in a SpriteBatch has 4 vertices in the following order: top-left, bottom-left, top-right, bottom-right. The index returned by SpriteBatch:add (and used by SpriteBatch:set) can be multiplied by 4 to determine the first vertex in a specific sprite.
trans-unit.target: SpriteBatch中的每个子图都有4个顶点，其顺序如下：左上，左下，右上，右下。SpriteBatch：add返回的索引（由SpriteBatch：set使用）可以乘以4以确定特定子画面中的第一个顶点。

trans-unit.source: Each sprite in a SpriteBatch has 4 vertices in the following order: top-left, bottom-left, top-right, bottom-right. The index returned by SpriteBatch:add (and used by SpriteBatch:set) can used to determine the first vertex of a specific sprite with the formula 1 + 4 * ( id - 1 ).
Each texture type has a different maximum size on a user's system. Use love.graphics.getSystemLimits to check.

Each vertex attribute component is initialized to 0 if its data type is "float", or 1 if its data type is "byte". Mesh:setVertices or Mesh:setVertex and Mesh:setDrawRange can be used to specify vertex information once the Mesh is created.

Each vertex attribute component is initialized to 0 if its data type is "float", or 255 if its data type is "byte". Mesh:setVertices or Mesh:setVertex and Mesh:setDrawRange can be used to specify vertex information once the Mesh is created.

trans-unit.source: Enables or deactivates vertical synchronization. Vsync tries to keep the game at a steady framerate and can prevent issues like screen tearing. It is recommended to keep vsync activated if you don't know about the possible implications of turning it off.

trans-unit.source: Enables or deactivates vertical synchronization. Vsync tries to keep the game at a steady framerate and can prevent issues like screen tearing. It is recommended to keep vsync activated if you don't know about the possible implications of turning it off. Before LÖVE 11.0, this value was boolean (true or false). Since LÖVE 11.0, this value is number (1 to enable vsync, 0 to disable vsync, -1 to use adaptive vsync when supported).

trans-unit.source: Enabling this window flag will automatically convert the colors of everything drawn to the main screen from the linear RGB colorspace to the sRGB colorspace - the window's surface is treated as gamma-space sRGB. This is only one component of gamma-correct rendering, an advanced topic which is easy to mess up, so it's recommended to keep this option disabled if you're not sure about its implications.

trans-unit.source: For detailed usage, see the reference manual.

trans-unit.source: For detailed usage, see the reference manual.

For example, a texture with pixel dimensions of 100x100 with a DPI scale factor of 2 will be drawn as if it was 50x50. This is useful with high-dpi / retina displays to easily allow swapping out higher or lower pixel density Images and Canvases without needing any extra manual scaling logic.
For example, if Mesh:setVertexMap(1, 2, 3, 1, 3, 4) and Mesh:setDrawRange(4, 2) are called, vertices 1, 3, and 4 will be drawn.
For example, if Mesh:setVertexMap(1, 2, 3, 1, 3, 4) and Mesh:setDrawRange(4, 6) are called, vertices 1, 3, and 4 will be drawn.
trans-unit.target: 例如，如果 Mesh:setVertexMap(1, 2, 3, 1, 3, 4) 和 Mesh:setDrawRange(4, 6) ，则将绘制顶点1、3和4。
